p: Acute cerebrovascular accident (CVA) is not unusual in critically ill cases with multiple co-morbidity. On the contrary, large vessel cerebral infarctions (LVCI) are rare among SARS cases, but when present outcomes are critical with the increased fatality rate ( Table 2 ). In one prospective study involving 5 cases, LVCI showed high susceptibility to thromboembolic episodes, with up to 1/3 of the critically ill cases ended up with deep vein thrombosis and hypercoagulable state [56], [57].
